thread.title: Pocono Mountains Family Resort Hosts First-Ever Nashville Songwriters Weekend
thread.title_full: Pocono Mountains Family Resort Hosts First-Ever Nashville Songwriters Weekend

title: Pocono Mountains Family Resort Hosts First-Ever Nashville Songwriters Weekend
text:
Pocono Mountains Family Resort Hosts First-Ever Nashville Songwriters Weekend Woodloch Resort Brings Nashville to the Pocono Mountains This November with Seven of Country Music's Top Songwriters October 20, 2015 14:36 ET | Source: Woodloch 
HAWLEY, Pa., Oct. 20,   Every November, guests flock to Woodloch Pines, an all-inclusive family resort in Pennsylvania's Pocono Mountains, to celebrate the Thanksgiving holiday at this nationally renowned, family-friendly getaway. While Thanksgiving is guaranteed to be just as special as ever this year, a different November weekend is garnering the most attention. From November 20th - 22nd, Woodloch will host its first-ever "Nashville Songwriters Weekend," where guests will get to meet the songwriters for some of today's most popular country performers including: Blake Shelton, Tim McGraw, Jason Aldean, Rascal Flatts, Keith Urban, and Big & Rich. 
The idea was originally conceived when Woodloch's Social Director, Joey Ranner, and long-time guest, Jon D'Agostino, were discussing their shared love of country music. It just so happens that D'Agostino is the owner of Demolition Music Publishing, the Nashville publishing firm on the world-famous "Music Row." The idea of bringing Nashville to Woodloch seemed only natural. 
"Music has always been a passion of mine," says D'Agostino. "Of course, I love listening to the final product from performers like Luke Bryan, Miranda Lambert and Rascal Flatts. Many of these acts, however, perform songs written by professional songwriters. For me, there's a definite thrill of knowing the real inspiration and stories to these popular songs that are all over the radio. The writers are somewhat unsung heroes." 
In addition to the bonfires, line-dancing, Southern BBQ and bourbon samplings that Woodloch has planned for the weekend, the all-inclusive resort will hold its very own songwriting competition. Over the years, Woodloch has hosted its own versions of talent shows themed after popular television shows such as American Idol and America's Got Talent. During the weekend, guests will have the chance to have their songwriting skills evaluated by a professional talent scout. In addition to receiving a complimentary stay at Woodloch, the winner(s) will have the eyes and attention of some of Nashville's top songwriters such as: Jeff Cohen, James, Slater, Dylan Altman, Jamie Floyd, Jimmy Robbins, Pete Sallis, and Adam Searan. 
"Putting all of this together, we thought it was the perfect time to create our first ever Woodloch Songwriting Competition," says Ranner. "We've heard some exceptional voices here, but there's also been a lot of great original music that has been shared. I'm excited to see how this pans out." 
During Nashville Songwriters Weekend, all-inclusive rates start at just $165 per adult per night. For more information or to book a stay during, please visit http://www.woodloch.com/specials/nashville or call 1.800.WOODLOCH. 
About Woodloch Pines Resort: 
Creating a magical experience for families since 1958, Woodloch Pines Resort's signature warm hospitality keeps guests returning year after year and offers a truly unique all-inclusive family vacation experience fitting for everyone's taste. An award-winning family resort, championship golf course and sister property featuring a luxury destination spa is just 95 scenic and convenient miles from New York City nestled in the Pocono Mountains Lake Region. Erica Bloch 570.685.8000 Related Articles other press releases by Woodloch Funds Raised for the 16th Annual BK Invitational, Held at Woodloch Springs Country Club, Allow Foundation to Cross the $1,000,000 Threshold, with Proceeds Benefiting Cancer Research October 14, 2015 12:36
